text:
Hi Aurelie!
Sorry for the late response, I've been having some issues with my laptop this week (it got infected with a virus), but it's all better now.
Of course! Thanks for the feedback, it was very helpful. I did a lot of work on it so this is what it looks like now

This was created as a portfolio piece, but after speaking with my professors, I realize it was a bit overly ambitious so I am going to be working on a different shot this month. I don't know if I have already mentioned it, but my school is a little different from others, in the sense that it is more fast paced. Instead of taking multiple classes over the course of a semester, we have 1-2 classes a month. So for this month, I got inspired by a project from an artist I met last month. He basically did a matte painting of a castle on a hill, and then comped some other elements into it. I'll share a link to his reel. The project I got inspired by is the very first one. <https://www.artstation.com/artwork/8lWavw>

attachments.title: VFX Compositing Demoreel 2018, Martin Humphrey
attachments.text: Realised at Think Tank Training Centre. I had the chance to be mentored by Danielle Norgate for this project. I'm showcasing a variety of skills such as keying, rotoscoping, projections, tracking, CG integration and color grading. Most of the work was realised in Nuke, also some matte painting was done in Photoshop and I also used some renders from Maya and Vray. Creating this reel was really challenging and I learned a lot from the whole process. I hope you enjoy it as much as I enjoyed doing it.
attachments.fallback: ArtStation: VFX Compositing Demoreel 2018, Martin Humphrey

text: I'm basically trying to go for a look similar to this and the Hogwarts castle from Harry Potter. I'll definitely send some updates as I go along. Hope you are doing well and staying safe! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey Violet :slightly_smiling_face: Glad to hear from you and that your computer is back!
The tunnel looks way better, good job !

Alright sounds good, the shot looks awesome that is a good inspiration :slightly_smiling_face: can't wait to see it ! Let me know if I can help in any way, if you have questions etc ..
